name: IKFilterUIView
desc: The IKFilterUIView class provides a view that contains input parameter controls for a Core Image filter (CIFilter). You need to use this class when providing a user interface for a custom filter. The class creates a view that has an object controller for the given filter. It also retains the filter.

items.name: class func view(withFrame: NSRect, filter: CIFilter!) -> Any!
items.desc: Creates a view that contains controls for the input parameters of a filter.

items.name: init!(frame: NSRect, filter: CIFilter!)
items.desc: Initializes a view that contains controls for the input parameters of a filter.

items.name: func filter() -> CIFilter!
items.desc: Returns the Core Image filter associated with the view.

items.name: func objectController() -> NSObjectController!
items.desc: Returns the object controller for the bindings between the filter and its view.
